title: Closing section teddy jump animation and Yes/No final choice

requirements.summary: Show a prominent teddy in the Closing section with a looping jump animation that respects prefers-reduced-motion and looks correct in light/dark themes.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user reaches the last/closing section, a teddy graphic is displayed prominently.
The teddy has a continuous jump/bounce animation (and respects prefers-reduced-motion by reducing/disabling the animation).
The teddy renders correctly in both light and dark themes without visual glitches.

file_operations.description: Add a prominently placed teddy image element in the Closing section and apply a dedicated looping jump/bounce animation class; adjust Closing section container styling to include dark theme variants so the teddy and surrounding content render cleanly in both themes.

Add a new utility animation (e.g., teddy jump/bounce keyframes + class) and ensure prefers-reduced-motion disables/reduces that animation (extend the existing reduced-motion media query to include the new class).

requirements.summary: Add Yes/No choice buttons in the Closing section and display the correct confirmation/playful messages while keeping existing actions available.
acceptanceCriteria: The Closing section includes two clearly labeled buttons: “Yes” and “No”.
Clicking “Yes” displays exactly: "I love you, wife garu" (English text).
Clicking “No” displays an English message that instructs the user to click “Yes” (e.g., "No means: go and click Yes.") without navigating away or breaking the flow.

The existing Closing section actions (“Back to Top”, “Replay Surprise”) remain available and continue working as before (either retained alongside the new buttons or reorganized without loss of functionality).

file_operations.description: Introduce local UI state to track the user's final choice and conditionally render the resulting message; add two new buttons labeled “Yes” and “No” that update the message accordingly, while retaining the existing “Back to Top” and “Replay Surprise” actions and ensuring layout remains responsive.

requirements.summary: Add the generated teddy image as a static frontend asset and reference it from the Closing section.
acceptanceCriteria: A teddy image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated and is referenced by the Closing section via a /assets/generated/... path.
The app builds successfully and the teddy image loads without 404s in the browser.

file_operations.description: Add the generated static image asset at this exact path so it can be loaded by the browser as a public file (no backend serving).

Reference the static teddy asset using the public path /assets/generated/valentine-teddy.dim_512x512.png and ensure it has appropriate alt text and sizing for prominent display in the Closing section.
